## [Synthesis Research]{.light-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

> Synthesis definition (according to LNO)

- LTER is hypothesis driven

\

- Means many disparate data are collected

\

- Useful backdrop for innovative synthesis work!

## [Working Groups & Synthesis]{.light-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Since 2016, funded 14 full working groups (\~4 meetings / 2 years)

\

- In 2022, funded 4 SPARC groups (1 meeting + 1 year support)
    - <u>S</u>cientific <u>P</u>eers <u>A</u>dvancing <u>R</u>esearch <u>C</u>ollaboration

\

- Proposals center around 1-3 synthesis hypotheses that use LTER data

\

- Groups are immensely productive (often **\~X** publications / group)

## [Grad Course & Working Groups]{.light-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Early career researcher (ECR) demand for synthesis training **_far_** outstrips working group capacity

\

- This course will help train ECRs in the quantitative _and_ inclusive facilitation skills that are the hallmark of synthesis research

\

- Course offerings are timed to leave students well prepared to apply for SPARC group funding

## [Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion]{.light-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- The network has two primary justice goals heading into our next funding cycle:

. . .

1. Greater cultural, socioeconomic, and gender diversity throughout the LTER network
    
. . .

2. More rapid and innovative synthesis

\

. . .

- This course is built--in part--to support these goals

## [Course Goals]{.dark-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- We have the following strategic goals for the course:

:::{.incremental}

- Surface and test new synthesis ideas for feasibility
- Prepare more graduate students to be effective participants in/leaders of synthesis projects
- Connect LTER graduate students across sites
- Develop intergenerational linkages around synthesis research 

:::

## [Course Structure]{.dark-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Course split into two major components
    1. Instructional modules
    2. Student-led synthesis projects

\ 

. . .

- Module order reflects typical synthesis project evolution

\

- More on [projects]{.dark-blue} shortly!

## [Course Logistics]{.dark-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Course runs for 9 months (Sept - May)
    - Biweekly synchronous virtual meetings

\

. . . 

- First full week in-person at NCEAS
    - Facilitate cohort sense of community
    - Students form groups of 5-6 with interest in shared project idea

\

. . . 

- \~30 students per cohort
    - \~1 / LTER site

\

## [Classes]{.dark-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Class meetings consist of **_inspiration_** and **_instruction_**
    - Inspiration = experienced synthesis scientist lends insight (60 min)
    - Instruction = work on topic of the week (120 min)

\

- Instruction by: LNO staff, guest speakers, LTER Network-recruited mentors
    - Likely including other NCEAS folx!

## [Module Categories]{.dark-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

\

15 proposed modules from two categories

\

. . .

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width="50%"}

### Team Science {{< fa people-group >}}

- Team Science Practices
- Inclusive Facilitation
- Supporting Divergent, Emergent, and Convergent Thinking
- Authorship & Intellectual Credit
- Project Management
- Logic Models
- Communicating Findings

:::

:::{.column width="50%"}

### Quantitative Skills {{< fa screwdriver-wrench >}}

- Reproducibility Best Practices
- Version Control
- Data Discovery & Management
- Data Visualization and Exploration
- Data Wrangling
- Analysis & Modeling
- Spatial Data & Interactivity
- Reproducible Reports

:::

::::

## [Team Science Emphasis]{.dark-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}


- Synthesis work _requires_ meaningful teamwork

\

- Modules focus on these "soft skills"
    - Consistent inclusivity angle to modules in this category

\

- Many of these skills are particularly absent from graduate school curricula

## [Quantitative Emphasis]{.dark-green}

![NCEAS logo](images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Synthesis work typically has **significant** data wrangling needs

\

- Extensive harmonizing often pre-requisite to the most fundamental exploration

\

- Quality control requires an in-depth examination of _each_ primary project's metadata
